Comment: Hello everybody! This is a game that i won before few days and i quite liked it! Well i started with e4.
He played e5. He would have played the Sicilian also!
Open the knight. I don't prefer d4 or Nc3.
That was a weak move i think as it affects king's defence and the hole kingside anyway.
I choosed d4, though i had also something else in my mind which i think it was stronger. 3.Ng5 fxg5 4.Qh5+ g6 5.Qxe5 Ne7 6.Qxh8! What do you think of that?
Ok a check then!
I played c3 to keep the bishop back instead Nc3.
He moved it back.
I took the pawn. I could have played Bc4 instead. What do you think it'll be better?
He took it.
Now i opened the bishop. I wanted to attack in the f7 square.
Logical i think.
I moved on with the knight.
Strange move and bad i think. He should have played 0-0 i guess.
And now the plan is simple. Exchange at first the knight in order to have a clean and free road for my queen to move on h5 square.
He took it and that's what i wanted. Maybe he ignored the threat. But the threat was not ignored him at all!
Check with the queen.
In order to a avoid checkmate.
I took his knight of course to clean the road.
He played with the king.
